HR_allfuncs module¶

HR_allfuncs.HR_peakdetect(data_array)¶

Returns a time array of times where peak was detected

Parameters:data_array – a 2-d array with time and voltage values
HR_allfuncs.brachy(average_hr_val, brachy_limit)¶
HR_allfuncs.brachy(average_hr_val, brachy_limit)

Determine if brachycardia occured during ECG acquisition.

Parameters:
  • average_hr_val – average HR value calculated from hr_averaging()
  • brachy_limit – brachycardia limit to be specified
Return type:

bool (True if brachycardia is not present, False if brachycardia is present)
HR_allfuncs.columncheck(filename)¶

..function columncheck(): makes sure the data is arranged in 2 columns

HR_allfuncs.dataextraction(filename)¶

..function: dataextraction(): opens CSV file, converts all numbers to float type, then creates an array to append rows

HR_allfuncs.datapracticality(filename)¶

..function: datapracticality(): checks that the signal is within an expected range (below 10mV

HR_allfuncs.datatypecheck(filename)¶

..function: datatypecheck(): makes sure there are no strings in the data

HR_allfuncs.hr_averaging(averaging_time, time_array)¶
HR_allfuncs.hr_averaging(averaging_time, tachy_limit = 100, brachy_limit = 60)

Calculate the average HR based upon ECG data.

Parameters:
  • averaging_time – time period (in min) used to calculate average HR
  • time_array – the time_array after peak_detect has been called
  • brachy_limit – sets the brachycardia threshold limit, defaults to 100
Return type:

integer value of average HR
HR_allfuncs.instHR(t_array)¶

Calculates instant heart rate from peak time array

Parameters:t_array – a 1-d list with time values of peaks
HR_allfuncs.tachy(average_hr_val, tachy_limit)¶
HR_allfuncs.tachy(average_hr_val, tachy_limit)

Determine if tachycardia occured during ECG acquisition.

Parameters:
  • average_hr_val – average HR value calculated from hr_averaging()
  • tachy_limit – tachycardia limit to be specified
Return type:

bool (True if tachycardia is not present, False if tachycardia is present)
